admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Technical Assistance
            Project for Mongolia were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, project sustainability was likely, Bank
            performance was satisfactory and Borrower performance was
            also a satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            government commitment remains central to implementation
            success. The enthusiasm of the Government was a critical
            factor in meeting project objectives. However, when the
            respective agency did not consider the specific advisory
            service relevant to its perceived needs, implementation was
            less successful. Umbrella-type projects with their high
            degree of flexibility require careful assessment of the
            Borrower's capacity to implement. Involvement of many
            international agencies may make project, related budget
            plans too complicated. While reliance on agencies to make
            their own work plans may make the process demand-driven and
            participatory, it may not always be appropriate or relevant
            in fulfilling objectives of project.
